ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I was helped by the feedback I received on my videotaped presentations to improve my presentation skills. I also enriched my vocabulary. Finally, I got some insights into my future interaction with Yale undergraduates.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the pronunciation section in the class can be more efficient. Currently, it is like student practice the pronunciation one by one.

Strengths: Presentations with feedback are a very good system. Discussion in class is engaging. Pronunciation sessions helpful to improve specific sounds. The exam in the end professionally organized. Weaknesses: Some of the in-class activities (mostly during pronunciation) were quite childish (like singing). Also, I think that 4 hours a week is a lot of time. My other courses were much shorter. Finally, I wish we had time to talk about some other things we planned to talk about (they were on the syllabus).
This class is really important to non-native speakers like me, it's well organized and helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Besides improving English, you can also meet a lot of student from all departments.
Yes, if they want to improve their English, definitely. By the end of the semester their English will be better.
This is one necessary course for non-native students, it can greatly improve your English speaking and listening skills, also you can learn how to teach during your later PhD years.
It gives good opportunities to present in English.
